message_1:
What is the plaintext message behind the following ciphertext using a substitution cipher with a 3-letter shift? 

Ciphertext: "FERGVNZRA VFAG FNLVAT"
 
(Hint: In a substitution cipher, each letter in the plaintext is "shifted" a certain number of positions down the alphabet. For example, with a 3-letter shift, A becomes D, B becomes E, C becomes F, and so on.)

To decrypt the ciphertext "FERGVNZRA VFAG FNLVAT" with a 3-letter shift, we will shift each letter 3 positions back in the alphabet.

E -> B
R -> O
G -> D
V -> S

A -> X
F -> C
V -> S

A -> X
